articles.title: Floral Basket from Great King of Cambodia
articles.content:
Floral Basket from Great King of Cambodia
 Pyongyang, February 13 (KCNA) -- General Secretary Kim Jong Il received a floral basket from Norodom Sihanouk, the great king of Cambodia, on the occasion of his birthday.
					 It was handed to the DPRK ambassador to China on Feb. 10.

articles.title: Lecture Given to Celebrate Kim Jong Il's Birthday
articles.content:
Lecture Given to Celebrate Kim Jong Il's Birthday
 Pyongyang, February 13 (KCNA) -- A lecture was given by the Central Standing Committee of the General Association of Korean Residents in Japan (Chongryon) at the Korean Hall in Tokyo on Feb. 11 to celebrate the birthday of General Secretary Kim Jong Il.
					 Present there were Chief Vice-Chairman Ho Jong Man and vice-chairmen of the Central Standing Committee of Chongryon, the chairman of the Central Audit Committee of Chongryon, advisors and department directors of the Central Standing Committee of Chongryon, leading officials of organizations and enterprises, chairmen of the Chongryon headquarters in the Kanto area and other officials.
					
					 The participants heard recorded lecture "The great leader bringing earlier a bright future of a thriving nation."

articles.title: British Political Party Calls for Learning from Kim Jong Il's Idea
articles.content:
British Political Party Calls for Learning from Kim Jong Il's Idea 
Pyongyang, February 13 (KCNA) -- An extraordinary plenary meeting of the Central Committee of the Communist Party of Great Britain (Marxist-Leninist) was held on Feb. 5 on the occasion of the birthday of General Secretary Kim Jong Il.
					 Chairman Harpal Brar in an opening address praised Kim Jong Il as the most faithful successor to the revolutionary cause of President Kim Il Sung.
					
					The birthday of Kim Jong Il is observed as the most important holiday of not only the Korean people but the international socialist movement, he added.
					
					 General Secretary Zane Carpenter said that Kim Jong Il imbued the whole society with the monolithic ideology, added that this was one of his greatest feats and one of the basic factors of the steady victory of socialism in the DPRK.
					
					 The meeting decided to continue learning from Kim Jong Il's idea of defending and advancing socialism and further boost the solidarity with the Workers' Party of Korea, the DPRK and the Korean people.

articles.title: Kim Jong Il's Noble Personality Praised by Foreign Media
articles.content:
Kim Jong Il's Noble Personality Praised by Foreign Media
Pyongyang, February 13 (KCNA) -- Foreign media carried special write-ups and articles on the occasion of General Secretary Kim Jong Il's birthday.
					 The February 3rd issue of the Ethiopian newspaper Daily Monitor allotted one whole page to a special write-up accompanied with his portrait and photos of him giving field guidance to the Taedonggang Combined Fruit Farm and the 927 Chicken Farm.
					
					 The paper in an article said he spent even his birthday for dedicating himself to the people.
					
					The February 7th issue of a Nepalese newspaper carried his portrait and an article titled "Son of the People." His rare simplicity and unassuming character are a manifestation of his noble trait as an ordinary man.
					
					 The February issue of a Pakistani magazine carried his portrait and photos on his revolutionary activities and devoted its four pages to introducing in detail his noble personality as the peerlessly great man. 
					
					 Bangladeshi newspapers carried special write-ups and articles on February 6 and 7.

articles.title: Day of Sun and February Holiday to Be Commemorated Abroad
articles.content:
Day of Sun and February Holiday to Be Commemorated Abroad
Pyongyang, February 13 (KCNA) -- Preparatory committees for commemorating the Day of the Sun, the birthday of President Kim Il Sung, and February 16, the birthday of General Secretary Kim Jong Il, were formed on February 4 in  Equatorial Guinea and Uganda.
					 Juan Nko Mbula, first deputy general secretary of the Democratic Party of Equatorial Guinea, and Kirunda Kivejinja, third deputy prime minister and minister of Internal Affairs of Uganda, were elected chairmen of the preparatory committees.
					
					 The committees decided to hold colorful political and cultural events on those occasions.

articles.title: Talks between Ministers of Security of DPRK and China Held
articles.content:
Talks between Ministers of Security of DPRK and China Held
						
 Pyongyang, February 13 (KCNA) -- Talks were held here on Sunday between Minister of People's Security Ju Sang Song who is member of the DPRK National Defence Commission and Minister of Public Security Meng Jianzhu who is state councilor of the People's Republic of China.
					 Present there from the DPRK side were Choe Jung Hwa, vice-minister of People's Security, and other officials of the Ministry of People's Security and from the Chinese side the party of the Chinese minister and Liu Hongcai, Chinese ambassador to the DPRK. 
					
					 At the talks both sides exchanged views on the issue of boosting the exchange and cooperation between the security organs of the two countries and matters of mutual concern.

articles.title: Agreement Signed between Security Organs of DPRK and China
articles.content:
Agreement Signed between Security Organs of DPRK and China
 Pyongyang, February 13 (KCNA) -- An agreement on cooperation between the Ministry of People's Security of the National Defence Commission of the DPRK and the Chinese Ministry of Public Security was signed here on Sunday.
					  Present at the signing ceremony from the DPRK side were Minister of People's Security Ju Sang Song, member of the NDC of the DPRK, officials of the ministry and from the Chinese side Minister of Public Security Meng Jianzhu who is state councilor of the People's Republic of China and his party, Liu Hongcai, Chinese ambassador to the DPRK.
					
					 The agreement was inked by Ju Sang Song and Meng Jianzhu.

articles.title: Aid Materials Donated by Chinese Ministry of Public Security
articles.content:
Aid Materials Donated by Chinese Ministry of Public Security
 Pyongyang, February 13 (KCNA) -- The Chinese Ministry of Public Security donated aid materials to the Ministry of People's Security of the DPRK.
					 A donating ceremony took place here on Sunday.
					
					 Present there from the DPRK side were Minister of People's Security Ju Sang Song who is member of the National Defence Commission of the DPRK and officials of the Ministry of People's Security and from the Chinese side Minister of Public Security Meng Jianzhu who is state councilor of the People's Republic of China and his party, Liu Hongcai, Chinese ambassador to the DPRK.

articles.title: Reception Given for Chinese Minister of Public Security
articles.content:
Reception Given for Chinese Minister of Public Security
 Pyongyang, February 13 (KCNA) -- The DPRK Ministry of People's Security hosted a reception at the Mansudae Assembly Hall on Sunday for the Chinese minister of Public Security and his party.       Present on invitation were Minister of Public Security Meng Jianzhu who is state councilor of the People's Republic of China and his party, Ambassador Liu Hongcai and staff members of the Chinese embassy here.
					 Minister of People's Security Ju Sang Song who is member of the DPRK National Defence Commission, Choe Jung Hwa, vice-minister of People's Security, and other officials of the Ministry of People's Security were present. 
					
					Ju Sang Song said in his speech that Meng Jianzhu's visit to the DPRK is significant as it is the first visit taking place this year to boost the DPRK-China friendship and it gives pleasure to the Korean army and people celebrating the birthday of General Secretary Kim Jong Il.
					
					 He referred to the fact that Kim Jong Il visited China twice last year and had significant meetings with the Chinese collective leadership including General Secretary Hu Jintao.
					
					 It is the consistent stand of the Workers' Party of Korea and the DPRK government to develop the traditional DPRK-China friendship generation after generation, he added.
					
					 He stressed that the DPRK would make every effort to boost the DPRK-China friendship in conformity with the intentions of the top leaders of the two countries this year marking the 50th anniversary of the conclusion of the DPRK-China Treaty of Friendship, Cooperation and Mutual Assistance.
					
					 Meng Jianzhu said that the Sino-DPRK friendship is a precious treasure provided by the leaders of the elder generation of the two countries. These friendly relations are steadily growing stronger under the deep care of General Secretary Hu Jintao and General Secretary Kim Jong Il, he added.
					
					 He noted that Kim Jong Il visited China twice last year, putting the bilateral friendly and cooperative relations on a new stage.
					
					 It is the steadfast policy of the Communist Party and people of China to boost the Sino-DPRK friendly and cooperative relations, he noted.
					
					 He expressed belief that the Korean people would register greater successes by effecting a new great revolutionary surge in building a thriving socialist nation under the leadership of the WPK headed by Kim Jong Il.

articles.title: Chinese Minister of Public Security Here
articles.content:
Chinese Minister of Public Security Here
 Pyongyang, February 13 (KCNA) -- Meng Jianzhu, minister of Public Security and state councilor of the People's Republic of China,  and his party arrived here Sunday.
					 They were greeted at the airport by Choe Jung Hwa, vice-minister of People's Security, and Liu Hongcai, Chinese ambassador to the DPRK.

articles.title: Gift to Kim Jong Il from Finland
articles.content:
Gift to Kim Jong Il from Finland
 Pyongyang, February 13 (KCNA) -- General Secretary Kim Jong Il received a gift from the Finnish Communists' League.
					 The gift was handed to Kim Yong Il, alternate member of the Political Bureau and secretary of the C.C., the Workers' Party of Korea, on Feb. 12 by Kalevi Wahrman, chairman of the League, on a visit to the DPRK.

articles.title: Rodong Sinmun Calls for Boosting South-South Cooperation
articles.content:
Rodong Sinmun Calls for Boosting South-South Cooperation
 Pyongyang, February 13 (KCNA) -- If the developing countries are to achieve independent development and economic prosperity in the new century, they should boost the South-South cooperation, observes Rodong Sinmun Sunday in a by-lined article.
					 It goes on:
					
					 The developing countries' development of the South-South cooperation is the course of putting an end to the relations of inequality with the Western countries and establishing instead a new fair international economic order in the new century. 
					
					 The above-said cooperation among the developing countries serves as an important way for raising their political position and role in the international arena. Only when they achieve economic self-support through collective self-reliance can they consolidate the political independence already won and defend their sovereignty. 
					
					 To achieve economic self-support by developing the said cooperation provides important conditions for increasing the self-reliant defence capability and building national power strong enough to cope with foreign interference. 
					
					 Many developing countries are making positive efforts to boost the cooperation among them, aware of the importance of South-South cooperation and its practical significance. 
					
					 They are called upon to push forward the above-said cooperation, regarding it as their consistent foreign policies to boost it, and give precedence to the process of putting the cooperation on an institutional basis to raise its effectiveness. 
					
					 No force on earth can arrest the just struggle of the people of the developing countries to boost the cooperation.

articles.title: S. Korean Organization Holds Authorities Responsible for Collapse of Dialogue
articles.content:
S. Korean Organization Holds Authorities Responsible for Collapse of Dialogue 
 Pyongyang, February 13 (KCNA) -- The south Korean Headquarters of the Movement for the Withdrawal of the U.S. Forces in a commentary on Feb. 10 said that the present regime was entirely to blame for the collapse of the preliminary talks for the opening of the north-south high-level military talks.
					 It charged that the authorities orchestrated such hideous conspiratorial charade as the "Cheonan" warship sinking incident but they are urging their dialogue partner to make what they called "apology" at the talks for improving the south-north relations. This is preposterous, indeed, it noted, and went on:
					
					 What they said over the issue of the level of military talks is nothing but rhetoric intended to invent a pretext for scuttling the talks, in the final analysis.
					
					The people are well aware that the responsibility for all the consequences entailed by the suspension of the south-north dialogue rests with the present regime.

articles.title: S. Korea Accused of Bringing Inter-Korean Talks to Rupture
articles.content:
S. Korea Accused of Bringing Inter-Korean Talks to Rupture
 Pyongyang, February 13 (KCNA) -- The People for Achieving Peace and Reunification in south Korea held a press conference in front of the building of the Defense Ministry on Feb. 10 condemning the authorities for bringing the preliminary talks for the opening of the north-south high-level military talks to rupture.
					  The organization charged that the talks broke down mainly because the south side insisted on its assertions, groundlessly urging the north to take a "responsible measure over the "Cheonan" warship incident and raising this as a precondition for dialogue. 
					
					 It continued: As the essence of the high-level military talks is to settle the grave situation at present when the danger of war is the greatest ever since the conclusion of the armistice agreement and provide conditions for dialogue, it is natural to discuss at the same time the issue of defusing the military tensions on the Korean Peninsula proposed by the north.
					
					 It accused the south side of bringing the talks to collapse in the end while insisting on its assertions despite the sincere efforts of the north.
					
					 The authorities took such stand for fear that the resumption of the south-north dialogue and the achievement of peace on the Korean Peninsula may lead to the loss of their power which has been maintained through the alliance with the U.S., it noted.
					
					 It bitterly slammed the present "government" for ignoring the opportunity of the hard-won dialogue for gratifying its treacherous ambition.

articles.title: Italian Committee for Study of Juche Idea Meets
articles.content:
Italian Committee for Study of Juche Idea Meets
						
 Pyongyang, February 13 (KCNA) -- An annual meeting of the Italian Committee for the Study of the Juche Idea held on Feb. 4  reviewed its work last year and discussed its working plan for this year.
					 It underscored the need to significantly hold colorful political and cultural events on the occasions of the birth anniversary of President Kim Il Sung and the birthday of General Secretary Kim Jong Il, most significantly commemorate the centenary of birth of the President and steadily expand the ranks of followers of the Juche idea. 
					
					 It was attended by chiefs and members of the organizations for the study of Juche idea of Italy and personages of the European Regional Association for the Study of the Juche Idea.

articles.title: Kim Jong Il's Work Published in Indonesia
articles.content:
Kim Jong Il's Work Published in Indonesia
Pyongyang, February 13 (KCNA) -- General Secretary Kim Jong Il's work "The Workers' Party of Korea Organizes and Guides All the Victories of Our People" was published in booklet by the Hekadaha Printing and Publishing House of Indonesia on Feb. 7.
					The work, published on Oct. 3, Juche 79 (1990), expounds the idea that the leadership of the party provides a sure guarantee for the victory of the socialist cause, the matter of developing the WPK into a revolutionary party of Juche type, the basic ways for the Party to discharge its mission and duty as a leading political organization, etc.
